Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cesin A (Nisin variant, natural AMPs; lantibiotic, type 1, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXW3, UCSS1b; BBW)

Literature.Author: Guo L, Wambui J, Wang C, Muchaamba F, Fernandez-Cantos MV, Broos J, Tasara T, Kuipers OP, Stephan R.2023
Literature.Title: Cesin, a short natural variant of nisin, displays potent antimicrobial activity against major pathogens despite lacking two C-terminal macrocycles.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (72%) toRombocin AActivity:  Active against L. lactis MG1363 (MIC 0.08 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes LMG10470 or TT82E or  LK132 (MIC 2.56-10.25 ug/ml), B. cereus CH-85 (MIC 20.5 ug/ml), S. aureus LMG10147 or LMG15975 MRSA (MIC 5.13 ug/ml), E. faecium LMG11423 or LMG16003 anti-VRE (MIC 5.13-10.25 ug/ml), E. faecalis LMG16216 VRE (MIC 5.13 ug/ml), C. perfringens CECT376 (MIC 0.5 ug/ml), and C-difficile CECT531 (MIC >31.5 ug/ml).SAR:  Despite lacking rings D and E, cesin demonstrates broad antimicrobial activity against Gram+ bacteria comparable to nisin Z.Recombinant production:bacteria:Lactococcus lactis: expressedx using the nisin-controlled gene expression system.MOA:bacteria:L. lactis MG1363: it binds to lipid II and lipoteichoic acid (LTA). Unable to form a pore on the membrane. Est.2/2024
